documentation.text:
@notice get festival organiser
 @return address of the festival organiser

@notice get selling price on primary market
 @return selling price

@notice get the minting status
 @return true if tickets have been minted

@notice get the tickets on sale on the secondary market
 @return ticketsOnSecondaryMarket

@notice get the tickets owned by one address
 @return list of tickets owned by the address

@notice get the tickets that are controlled by the organiser
 @return list of tickets controlled by the organiser

@notice get the list of customers who bought
 @return list of buyers

@notice check if support interface 
 @return true if supports

params.numberOfTickets: The number of tickets minted in the batch
params.operator: The address of the operator. The NFT are minted to this address.

returns._0: true if tickets have been minted

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: price of purchase, selling price (if any), if ticket on sale
list of tickets owned by the address
list of tickets controlled by the organiser

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.buyer: address of the customer buying the ticket
params.ticketId: id of the ticket the customer wants to buy

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.ticketId: id of the ticket the customer wants to buy

params.newPrice: new price on the secondary market
params.operator: needs to be approved so that the ticket can be transferred when it is bought

_minted.details: to check if the tickets have already been minted

ticketsHistory.details: mapping holding the ticketsInfo of all the tickets

ticketsOnSecondaryMarket.details: array that holds the id of the tickets on sale on the secondary market

ticketsOwnedByAddress.details: mapping to check which tickets are owned by one address

ticketsOwnedByOrganiser.details: tickets that are under the control of the owner

BatchMinted().notice: event emitted when tickets have been minted

batchMint(uint256,address).notice: function that mints the ticket. They are minted to the address of the transactionsLogic smart contract linked to the festival

getInitSellingPrice().notice: get selling price on primary market

getTicketInfo(uint256).notice: get the info related to a particular ticket

getTicketsBuyers().notice: get the list of customers who bought

getTicketsOnSecondaryMarket().notice: get the tickets on sale on the secondary market

getTicketsOwnedByAddress(address).notice: get the tickets owned by one address

getTicketsOwnedByOrganiser().notice: get the tickets that are controlled by the organiser

primaryPurchaseTransfer(address,uint256).notice: transfer the NFT when it is bought on the primary market

secondaryPurchaseTransfer(address,uint25.notice: transfer the NFT when it is bought on the secondary market

setTicketOnSale(uint256,uint256,address).notice: let customers set their tickets on sale

userdoc.notice: This contract is the ERC721 that is used to mint the festival tickets
